alert.note: Alert for Northern Monterey Bay; Santa Clara Valley Including San Jose; Santa Cruz Mountains (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 21 at 12:33PM PDT by NWS Monterey
info.description: ...A strong storm will impact portions of central Santa Cruz and southwestern Santa Clara Counties through 130 PM PDT. Strongest winds are expected in the Santa Cruz Mountains... At 1229 PM PDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong storm off the San Cruz Coastline. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 57 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated and wind gusts at the Monterey airport have already exceeded 50 mph. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down trees, blow around unsecured objects, and create power outages. Locations impacted include... Santa Cruz, Morgan Hill, Corralitos, Scotts Valley, Capitola, Live Oak, Boulder Creek, Aptos, Twin Lakes, Ben Lomond, Brown Valley Road, Eureka Canyon Road, Felton, Uvas Canyon Park, Rio Del Mar, Soquel, Opal Cliffs, Amesti, Freedom and Aptos Hills-Larkin Valley. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Northern Monterey Bay; Santa Clara Valley Including San Jose; Santa Cruz Mountains
